website_summaries.verdict: The Wave Paradox 2 from Mizuno is a great-looking running shoe that has a lot of features for runners who need added support and protection. The multiple color choices make it appealing, and the efficient components enable it to function well for daily runs.
pros: The PU Printed Overlays offer a more responsible wrap in the heel and mid foot sections
Most reviewers welcomed the Ortholite technology in the sock liner as it offers anti-microbial properties to keep the interior environment healthy
The Mizuno Wave runs along the heel to the mid foot area of the sole unit, keeping a bouncy and well-supported ride
The Extended Wave Plate found in the mid-foot area provides torsional rigidity for a more controlled step
The U4ic is lightweight mid-sole unit that has shock absorption mechanics, as well as durability and resilience
Runners generally appreciated the X10 outsole, which is a durable material that offers sure traction
cons: The 2nd version of the Wave Paradox has a slightly expensive price
The men’s version has a moderately heavy weight
Some runners felt that this shoe became very warm, thus making it uncomfortable for longer races
A few noted that it wasn’t as responsive because of the heightened stiffness and thicker mid-sole

customer_reviews.title: Good Stability Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've used dozens of different running shoes over many years of running. These are heavy stability shoes. I'm using them because I'm having some ankle problems and they are very sturdy. I wouldn't wear them for racing, but if you need the stability, these are good shoes. Fairly expensive compared to other brands and models.
customer_reviews.author: Pkg Guy

customer_reviews.title: SIGNIFICANTLY and I had the older mizuno shoes from about 5 years ago that helped with these so I needed a replacement bad. thes
customer_reviews.text: I over pronate. . . SIGNIFICANTLY and I had the older mizuno shoes from about 5 years ago that helped with these so I needed a replacement bad. these are even more supportive I feel then my last ones as the inner arch and heel are definitely beefier (which makes the shoe totally look goofy, but I don't care, it allows me to run for more than 3 miles without knee pain. aside from that they actually breath very well, and I could probably wear them all day, BUT I just wear them for running as that is when I would actually have pain.
customer_reviews.author: Andy & Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not as cushioned as I had expected and the leather bump over the toe hit my toe.
customer_reviews.text: They did not have as much cushion under the ball of the foot as I had hoped. I bought them to use at the gym, weight lifting and walking on the treadmill on an incline. The toe also has a little piece of leather that is on top, over the mesh, and my toe hit it, because my toes lift when I walk.
customer_reviews.author: OrganicBeauty

customer_reviews.title: but this runned a little small are great quality, so maybe size it up by
customer_reviews.text: i got his as a gift, i've giving my hubby lot of shoes i get online, always the same size, but this runned a little small are great quality, so maybe size it up by.5
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Stable as a Table
customer_reviews.text: Definitely runs a half size smaller and a size narrower. Great support. I have issues with plantar fasciitis and general foot pain due to excessive pronation but the stability of this shoe helps immensely. Works great with my Superfeet insert. Only four stars due to inconsistent sizing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stez

customer_reviews.title: Love these Mizuno's for moderate pronation
customer_reviews.text: I love Mizuno's and was very dissapointed when they discontinued the Wave Nirvana. I like these even more. They are extremely well cushioned (better than the Nirvana), and wear very well. I have moderate pronation, 6'3" and 180 lbs., and these work perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Holcombe

customer_reviews.title: Great Tennis Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This was my boyfriend’s second pair of shoes because he likes them so much. Great running shoe with solid support.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as always
customer_reviews.text: Very solid base provided comfortable support. I’ve got a few issues with my feet/toes and these provide enough support for me to run (and walk) in comfort. Not easy to find these awesome runners anymore. These are replacing my previous pair, and fit equally well.
customer_reviews.author: Taz Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of wave paradox running shoes. I like them because they are semi rigid and supportive. I typically will put 400 miles on a pair and retire them. Love the shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, albiet a little narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these shoes are a standout from shoes I have used in the past. I run distances of 4-6 miles at least every other day and these shoes provide adequate support for, at least, the first couple miles. Due to the more narrow nature of the show, they start to cramp my foot right where the laces tie down. I would guess that the wide variant fits as expected, but these felt a little narrow even for normal sized shoes. Outside of that, these shoes feel nice on the foot.
customer_reviews.author: OB1_Otto

customer_reviews.title: yet they a great wrap and secure feeling
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno Paradox 2 running shoes were everything I expected and more. They are extremely lightweight and flexible, yet they a great wrap and secure feeling. They have a nice cushioned heel and actually have a sort of propelling feel to them when walking or running. The comfort is just great. I have been running in Asics shoes for quite a while but, and not taking anything away from Asics, these shoes feel even better.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Munn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the first version when Mizuno stopped making the Alchemy since this was suppose to be the replacement. It was ok just didn't last nearly as long. I decided to give these a shot hoping for positive changes but I was very disappointed. I feel like they have no support and the fit was off and that is with 3 miles of running on them. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T Keever

customer_reviews.title: A good motion control shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a good replacement for the Mizuno Wave Alchemy (versions 9-12) that I wore for years. The Paradox2 provides good support and it is fairly light-weight, unlike some motion control running shoes. I have purchased a second pair at a sale price. I give this a four star rating because I cannot yet determine if this shoe is durable, given that I have only run in it for one month.
customer_reviews.author: William Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoe at an excellent price. It replaces my worn out previous version of this shoe. Fits exactly as expected and is doing precisely the same job as my previous pair.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light enough not to interfere with my running ...
customer_reviews.text: So I switched to mizuno's about 2 years ago with the first Paradox and since then is a must have for all my running! Comfortable, light enough not to interfere with my running style but sturdy enough to offer full support.
customer_reviews.author: Alitos

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes because I over-pronate and needed more arch support. They fit my foot well and give great arch support. My ankles used to turn inwards and no they are straighter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mcandrew

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Have been a fan of Mizuno for years and years. As long as you understand that their shorter usable life is a tradeoff for extreme comfort and performance you too will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Firm/Supportive
customer_reviews.text: Shoe feels firm and supportive but not squishy. My right foot tends to slide outward in most shoes but I seem to get more more guidance and less slippage with the Mizuno Paradox. Well built shoe. On the heavy side. I also added a SuperFeet orthotic which I wear in all my training and running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Don B.

customer_reviews.title: Sticking with Mizuno Paradox
customer_reviews.text: They come with very flat inserts, so if you have a high arch, you will probably want to change them out. Other than that, these are a great upgrade from the original Paradox. This is my second pair of Paradox and I was pleasantly surprised by the first pair. Hadn't really heard of Mizuno before.
customer_reviews.author: SEB

customer_reviews.title: ... in the wave nirvana 8s and these are a perfect (maybe even better) replacement
customer_reviews.text: I lived in the wave nirvana 8s and these are a perfect (maybe even better) replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J-Glo

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the purchase of these sneaks
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the purchase of these sneaks. Fit perfectly. Lots of extra support. The laces stay tied unlike my other Mizuno sneakers. And they look very nice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Dorsa

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: These shoes offer excellent support. I use them mainly for jogging and running. However, for those who are into comfortable as in "soft" shoes, these aren't for them.
customer_reviews.author: Nichi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little tight at first, but once broken in very supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Ben A

customer_reviews.title: My expectations of this shoe were already established, as ...
customer_reviews.text: My expectations of this shoe were already established, as I have owned a previous model. Thankfully the toes still provide "extra" room compared to other brand's running shoes. I gave them a 5k right when they got in. The cushion was refreshing!... I should have ordered new running shoes sooner. I did goto Mizuno's website and do some research. If you're on the fence about these shoes, take the chance!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Schraff

customer_reviews.title: Half Marathon here I come
customer_reviews.text: Had this brand of shoe fitted through a podiatrist due to a significant legacy knee injury. Mizen has never let me down and these are the latest iteration of my original fit. They are really good and I have managed to buy the last pair in Singapore and a couple more off Amazon. Training for half marathons in Singapore does not make shoes last long here so the three pairs means I can alway dry them between runs. I am very pleased with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Scott

customer_reviews.title: ... and support is the same to maybe a little better
customer_reviews.text: They are a little stiffer than the inspire wave but other than that fit is the same and support is the same to maybe a little better

customer_reviews.title: Supportive sneakers
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a very strong and supportive shoe that also is very cushioned. It is good for any type of exercise you want to engage in.
customer_reviews.author: ddercola

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing shoes I've been training with these babys for more ...
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing shoes I've been training with these babys for more than six months and the damage they show is almost imperceptible
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good Update
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the first paradox, this is quite the improvement. It has decent motion control, a better arch, and a better upper. However the heel counter is still irritating like it wants to force you down instead of rolling you into the stride. Also, while the upper is better this time around, I still find it lackluster. The previous one was simply more interesting and I vastly prefer welding and 3D print to overlays, but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Alchemys in disguise
customer_reviews.text: Have been a fan of alchemys forever, these are perfect fit and provide good stability. I went away from alchemys to kayanos but after trying kayano 22s I had to switch back. If you like your shoes to be low on the squishy side, you'll love em.
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat Mizunos
customer_reviews.text: Buying these for my husband. Been buying these for myself for many years. Great support. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: BostonLady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for and 1/3 of the retail price
customer_reviews.author: T.scrivner

customer_reviews.title: Love so much have 5 pair
customer_reviews.text: This is an older style but my husband loves so much he has bought a total of 5 pair over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Persistence

customer_reviews.title: ... tried them on I thought this was the most comfortable running shoe I have ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I minute I tried them on I thought this was the most comfortable running shoe I have ever worn. Great support and super cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Brad F

customer_reviews.title: I won't run in anything else now.
customer_reviews.text: These are my new go-to shoes. And the color is actually tolerable this year. (Color and visual design change every year, but the fit, comfort and support are always spot on.)
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: They fit just like Nirvana...best so far
customer_reviews.text: These paradox 2 fit exactly the same as the old nirvana. The first paradox were trash...never liked the fit, but with this model, mizuno nailed it again. Thanks. (5'10", 215lbs)
customer_reviews.author: Alex G.

customer_reviews.title: Glue smell was heavy for half a month still smell ...
customer_reviews.text: Glue smell was heavy for half a month still smell of glue without other Mizuno shoes to contrast do not know true or false
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes, my husband is very happy with the fit, comfort and style and walks miles in them!
customer_reviews.author: Unleesonced Minkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough to buy a second pair
customer_reviews.text: I already had a pair of these so I knew what I was getting. Just wanted a second pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for Mizuno
customer_reviews.text: Something seems off with the design. Heel feels like it pulls down after striking with ball of foot. Took them for 2 test runs and experienced arch pain after both. This was disappointing as I put a lot of miles in on the Catalyst and Wave Rider models.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Kalbach

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support but a tad narrow.
customer_reviews.text: My work requires me to be on my feet all day. Nice, rigid arch support, comfortable enough but a bit narrow compared to Asics.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has the arch support to perform when outhers lack the strength.
customer_reviews.author: James Dove

customer_reviews.title: He said he has never had more comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Girt for my husband. He said he has never had more comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: though not as bad as before
customer_reviews.text: So far they're just okay... a little tight in the ankles. got the wide ones and I'm still scraping the sides of the shoes, though not as bad as before. If I can manage to break these in I'll give it a better rate later.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mather

customer_reviews.title: Great fit if you have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Was a little nervous buying these online but I had purchased different Mizuno models before and they fit well for my relatively wide foot. Even still I was surprised that these fit perfectly--they are very comfortable and provide tons of stability, which is a top priority for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E Byers

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely comfortable and really really good quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely comfortable and really really good quality shoes. Can run on these for a long time and they are very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Vinay

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable pair
customer_reviews.text: Would have been perfect had the arch support had been higher. The front toe area cringed a little.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was a little worried about the size but it fitted as expected and it is really comfortable for those people that have flat fee
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift to my husband. I was a little worried about the size but it fitted as expected and it is really comfortable for those people that have flat feet. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Fits wider than same shoe in blue. Go figure.
customer_reviews.text: Strangely, this has a wider fit than the exact same shoe in blue. I thought Mizuno had better quality standards than that.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Go 1/2 size bigger for good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe. The fit was smaller than my last pair of Muzunos. I had to get a 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bartos

customer_reviews.title: Great feeling shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling shoe!!!...finally found a shoe that works for a big guy with flat feet ...will be buying more down the road.
customer_reviews.author: so cool

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit was somewhat short in length comparing to other brands that I have purchased. Changed out the insoles for others with a higher arch support. Great looking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, Mizuno!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Bought these to eliminate arch and shin pain during runs. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob T. Culbertson

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: It's early but I like them. They feel very different from Nike arch, almost like foot is is landing with ankle in, but seems to be better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great support for over pronator
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. I over-pronate quite significantly, and these support my feet and ankles nicely. Very happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It all starts with the shoes...
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno makes a great product line... Excellent shoes for running after work, or just running around at work - very good support and comfort in lightweight, well made shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Jensen

customer_reviews.title: They felt good for the run
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4", weigh 220, and ran a Marathon in them. They felt good for the run.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie Runner

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: Great arch support. I'm on my feet 8 to 10 hours a day on concrete. No more back pain. this is my second pair. No break in time needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes! I have a wide foot and these fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have arch support but it's true sized. Don't order half size up as instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! I love mizuno they never let you down in the products that they offer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Get a great run in with these shoes. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mura

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed and very attractive appearance-wise
customer_reviews.text: Nicely constructed and very attractive appearance-wise. Unlike my Made-in-USA New Balance 950's which are slightly large on my feet, this Mizuno pair and a pair of Asics Gel-Noosa 8's all in size 10.5 are tight fitting. It seems there needs to be a need for a new size standard for both size and width.
customer_reviews.author: wblobsta

customer_reviews.title: Mizuno is a great brand. These didnt feel as supportive as others ...
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno is a great brand. These didnt feel as supportive as others I have bought but I have worn them all day on long walks and evensome hikes and my feet felt ok. I hope they continue the quality of their shoes.
customer_reviews.author: agent210

customer_reviews.title: Kind of an odd fit
customer_reviews.text: These shoes really needed a break in period, probably more than any I've had. They also ran a little small. Probably get my usual Brooks for my next pair. Bottoms of feet were sore more often than usual after 5 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell Shortt

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Pair of Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Always pleased with Mizuno Running Shoes, perfect fit and addresses my pronation problem as well. The fit is perfect and they are very comfortable for walking or running. I was previously wearing New Balance shoes. Was first introduced to this running shoe "Brand" by a Dick's Sporting Goods" sales person, in 2005. I have not used another brand since. I am so glad I found this Brand and the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: C A Price Jr

customer_reviews.title: It's very comfortable when I wear them
customer_reviews.text: It's very comfortable when I wear them,It should deserve five star.But when I open the package,there is a strong strange smell,I don't know why? And I hope there is no any poisonous stuff in them.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Most Supportive running Shoes I have Owned
customer_reviews.text: shoes are great I have a bad lower back and run on a trail and the shoes provide great support for my runs which are between 2-3 miles every other day.
customer_reviews.author: sam carnacchi

customer_reviews.title: ... of Mizuno shoes and these are by far my favorite pair. The 2E shoes fit my wife foot ...
customer_reviews.text: I own four other pairs of Mizuno shoes and these are by far my favorite pair. The 2E shoes fit my wide foot perfectly, provide fairly good arch support, and feel durable. These runs a bit more expensive than my inspire or wave paradox shoes, but the materials feel much more durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This pair did not run true to size so returned. They were to small.
customer_reviews.author: bigheart

customer_reviews.title: I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.text: I'm hooked on Mizuno shoes. They alleviate my overpronation and flat feet pain. I know when I need to replace as my old pains return. But within days of replacing, pain is gone again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chilvers

customer_reviews.title: Like a glove
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits like a glove! I am a big fan of Mizuno stability shoes and the Paradox 2 continues to impress. it fits snug around the instep with little stretch, so make sure the laces are loose. It is as though the shoe is pre formed.
customer_reviews.author: Xander Jül

product_meta.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Paradox 2 Low Top Fabric Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Whether you're walking, jogging, running, working, or relaxing you seem to find yourself continuously on your feet. And with all that wear-and-tear you want to make certain that your feet don't let you down and wear you out in the process. That's where your Mizuno sports shoes come into play. Their strategically engineered design that includes a patented manmade type sole with multiple numbers of foot enhancing and comforting supports assures you that no matter what the day throws at you that you can take it and keep going. For the very best in sturdiness and wear-ability you simply can't beat this pair of Mizuno shoes. Their incredible light-weight construction and mid-sole 1.25in platform make this pair of shoes the ultimate in both comfort and style. Once you take your first step in these beauties you will instantly know that these are shortly going to be your go-to pair of sports shoes for all kinds of occasions. These versatile and technically advanced shoes will allow you to glide painlessly and effortlessly over almost any terrain. The outside pattern only adds to the excitement of what this Mizuno style of shoe can help you overcome as you travel all of life's highways and by-ways in colorful style. The shock-absorbing cushioning found inside each shoe will work small miracles in making your foot feel like a million bucks every time you slip these babies on, and the fabric uppers performs wonderfully in wicking away moisture that might otherwise add to your discomfort. Flexibility, support, and comfort all in one pair of shoes is what makes your pair of Mizuno shoes perfect for all your sports shoe requirements. Quality manufacturing, inspiring design and cut, and the perfect answer to your specific needs makes these Mizuno shoes a competitive answer for any sports bid that you might have on your short list.
feature_bullets: Supportive trainer featuring internal stability technology with minimal overlays
Double Fan Wave Technology for maximum support
Soft breathable mesh upper with secure mid foot wrap ensures a great fit with minimal overlays for friction free wear
